title: AKIN Classification for Acute Kidney Injury (AKI)
description: Classifies severity of acute kidney injury based on serum creatinine and urine output criteria within 48 hours

parameters.name: baseline_creatinine
parameters.description: Baseline serum creatinine in mg/dL (if known)

parameters.name: creatinine_increase
parameters.description: Absolute increase in creatinine from baseline in mg/dL (if baseline known)

parameters.name: urine_output_6h
parameters.description: Urine output over 6 hours in mL/kg

parameters.name: urine_output_12h
parameters.description: Urine output over 12 hours in mL/kg

parameters.name: urine_output_24h
parameters.description: Urine output over 24 hours in mL/kg

parameters.name: on_rrt
parameters.description: Patient on renal replacement therapy (automatically Stage 3)

ranges.interpretation: No criteria met for acute kidney injury. Normal kidney function or chronic kidney disease without acute deterioration.
Stage 1 AKI: Absolute increase in creatinine ≥0.3 mg/dL or 1.5-2x baseline, OR urine output <0.5 mL/kg/hr for >6 hours. Requires close monitoring and nephrology consultation.
Stage 2 AKI: Creatinine 2-3x baseline OR urine output <0.5 mL/kg/hr for >12 hours. Requires intensive monitoring and nephrology consultation.

Stage 3 AKI: Creatinine >3x baseline or ≥4.0 mg/dL with acute increase ≥0.5 mg/dL, OR urine output <0.3 mL/kg/hr for ≥24 hours or anuria for 12 hours, OR on RRT. Requires urgent nephrology consultation and consideration of renal replacement therapy.

references: Mehta RL, Kellum JA, Shah SV, et al. Acute Kidney Injury Network: report of an initiative to improve outcomes in acute kidney injury. Crit Care. 2007;11(2):R31.
Lopes JA, Jorge S. The RIFLE and AKIN classifications for acute kidney injury: a critical and comprehensive review. Clin Kidney J. 2013;6(1):8-14.
Xiong J, Tang X, Hu Z, et al. The RIFLE versus AKIN classification for incidence and mortality of acute kidney injury in critical ill patients: A meta-analysis. Sci Rep. 2015;5:17917.
formula: Stage 1: Cr ≥0.3 mg/dL increase or 1.5-2x baseline OR UO <0.5 mL/kg/hr x >6h; Stage 2: Cr 2-3x baseline OR UO <0.5 mL/kg/hr x >12h; Stage 3: Cr >3x baseline or ≥4.0 mg/dL with acute increase ≥0.5 mg/dL OR UO <0.3 mL/kg/hr x ≥24h or anuria x 12h OR RRT
notes: AKIN classification requires changes within 48 hours
Diagnosis requires adequate hydration and exclusion of urinary obstruction
Patients on RRT are automatically classified as Stage 3
Two creatinine measurements within 48 hours are required
Baseline creatinine not required - can use first reference reading
Stage corresponds to highest criterion met (creatinine or urine output)
More sensitive than RIFLE for detecting mild AKI
Associated with increased mortality even at Stage 1
Important for clinical decision-making and prognosis
Should be used with clinical context and other assessments
